pullRequest.body:
Let `R` be a commutative ring and `A` and `B` two `R`-algebras.
- `Subalgebra.centralizer_sup`: if `S` and `T` are subalgebras of `A`, then the centralizer of
  `S ⊔ T` is the intersection of the centralizer of `S` and the centralizer of `T`.
- `Subalgebra.centralizer_range_includeLeft_eq_center_tensorProduct`: if `B` is free as a module,
  then the centralizer of `A` in `A ⊗ B` is `C(A) ⊗ B` where `C(A)` is the center of `A`.
- `Subalgebra.centralizer_range_includeRight_eq_center_tensorProduct`: if `A` is free as a module,
  then the centralizer of `B` in `A ⊗ B` is `A ⊗ C(B)` where `C(B)` is the center of `B`.


---

### PR summary [7c0e0d0c78](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18764/commits/7c0e0d0c78b3d0fca8fce000962f917aeb6e7000)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Algebra.Subalgebra.Centralizer`|958|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ centralizer_iSup`
`+ centralizer_range_includeLeft_eq_center_tensorProduct`
`+ centralizer_range_includeRight_eq_center_tensorProduct`
`+ centralizer_sup`
`+ centralizer_tensorProduct_eq_center_tensorProduct_left`
`+ centralizer_tensorProduct_eq_center_tensorProduct_right`
`+ comm_comp_includeLeft`
`+ comm_comp_includeRight`
`+ comm_comp_map`
`+ comm_comp_map_apply`
`+ comp_ofId`
`+ iSup_induction`
`+ mem_iSup_of_mem`
`+ range_ofId`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Thanks for the PR!

I would call the file `Centralizer.lean` as centers are just special cases of them.

Thanks for the PR!

I would call the file `Centralizer.lean` as centers are just special cases of them.
Good point, I will change it to `(TensorProduct.comm R C D : C ⊗[R] D →ₐ[R] D ⊗[R] C)`
Can you provide the `iSup` and `sSup` versions as well?

I'd only request the `iSup` version as it's easy to use [sSup_eq_iSup'](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/CompleteLattice.html#sSup_eq_iSup') when you do encounter `sSup`.
Are you identifying `Set A` with `A → Prop` here? Not sure if it's just a code smell or should actually be changed
Is this in the right shape to be useable with the induction tactic?

Here's a golf that avoids induction:
```suggestion
lemma le_centralizer_iff (S T : Subalgebra R A) : S ≤ centralizer R T ↔ T ≤ centralizer R S :=
  ⟨fun h t ht _ hs ↦ (h hs t ht).symm, fun h s hs _ ht ↦ (h ht s hs).symm⟩

lemma centralizer_sup (S T : Subalgebra R A) :
    centralizer R ((S ⊔ T : Subalgebra R A) : Set A) = centralizer R S ⊓ centralizer R T := by
  refine eq_of_forall_le_iff fun K ↦ ?_
  simp_rw [le_centralizer_iff, sup_le_iff, le_inf_iff, K.le_centralizer_iff]

lemma centralizer_iSup {ι : Sort*} (S : ι → Subalgebra R A) :
    centralizer R ((⨆ i, S i : Subalgebra R A) : Set A) = ⨅ i, centralizer R (S i) := by
  refine eq_of_forall_le_iff fun K ↦ ?_
  simp_rw [le_centralizer_iff, iSup_le_iff, le_iInf_iff, K.le_centralizer_iff]
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra/Subalgebra): some lemmas about centralizers
